name: royally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
very much: You've messed up royally this time! That was a royally stupid thing to say.
very well, as if intended for or typical of a king or queen: We always get treated royally when we stay here. As a young man earning a large salary, he lived royally for a good few years.
in a way connected to a king or queen, or a member of their family: The queen made a triumphant entrance to the town, escorted royally by the two princesses. Responsibility for managing and protecting the property belongs to a royally appointed official.
More examplesFewer examplesThe group was royally entertained by Susan's stories of her time as a doctor.After the disappointing news, they decided that the best thing they could do was to get royally drunk.We lunched royally on oysters, smoked salmon, and freshly baked rolls.
